content:
I'll create a report based on the provided logs:

EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining System (41, -85)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (41, -85)
- Wooden chest at (43.5, -83.5)
- Burner inserter at (42.5, -83.5) connecting drill to chest
Current status: Drill needs fuel, chest contains 306 coal, inserter has 13 coal

### Iron Production System 1 (-20, -54)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-20, -54) mining iron ore
- Stone furnace at (-19, -52)
Current status: System is working but output is blocked, drill has 16 coal, furnace has 15 coal

### Iron Production System 2 (-14, -56)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-14, -56) mining iron ore
- Stone furnace at (-13, -54)
Current status: System is working but output is blocked, drill has 12 coal, furnace has 4 coal

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Placement Errors
- When placing inserters, ensure there is sufficient space and no existing entities at the target location
- Check for collisions with existing structures before placement
- Consider the direction and spacing parameters when using place_entity_next_to()

### Resource Management
- Monitor coal levels in furnaces and ensure sufficient coal is available before attempting to insert
- Keep track of inventory coal levels to prevent failed insertion attempts

### Output Blocking
- Mining drills are showing "output blocked" warnings due to missing sink entities
- Ensure proper item collection system is in place before starting production

NAMESPACE

Functions:
- place_entity_next_to(): Places an entity adjacent to a reference position with specified spacing and direction
- place_entity(): Places an entity at specific coordinates
- insert_item(): Inserts items into an entity's inventory

Important Variables:
- furnace1, furnace2: Stone furnace entities
- new_inserter1, new_inserter2: Burner inserter entities

Function Failure Modes:
- place_entity_next_to(): Fails when target position is blocked or invalid
- insert_item(): Fails when source inventory lacks required items
- place_entity(): Fails when target position is occupied
